verb.description: (of a country or its government) prepare and organize (troops) for active service.
examples: the government mobilized regular forces, reservists, and militia
Russia is in no position to mobilize any time soon

verb.description: Make (something) movable or capable of movement.
examples: doing yoga stretches to mobilize compacted joints

origin: Mid 19th century: from French mobiliser, from mobile (see mobile).
